attributes.action: Please let us keep our green spaces and don’t allow the building in hellingly!
attributes.additional_details: This development must not go ahead. It would devastate Hellingly, known for its beauty, wildlife, and community spaces. The village can't handle more traffic, and current data ignores the wildlife future and current residents from nearby developments. Local services—schools, hospitals, dentists—are already overwhelmed. The Cuckmere River floods more due to overbuilding. The view and character of the area will be ruined by this intrusive, inappropriate development. With views of the downs ruined
attributes.background:
There is a building proposal Planning ref: WD/2025/6509/SO of 300 houses to be put in place instead of a beautiful field which is used regularly for dog walkers with a stunning view, with lots of wild life in the area.
Our community would appreciate the proposal being refused to save our village.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
